medical_history.chief_complaint: Obesity and hyperphagia associated with Prader-Willi syndrome.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began with neonatal hypotonia. Weight gain was first noted at age 4, with food seeking behaviors beginning around age 6. By age 6, the patient’s weight exceeded the 97th percentile, while height remained between the 10th and 25th percentiles. Food-seeking behaviors included unusual consumption habits and stealing food.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diagnosed with Prader-Willi syndrome at age 14 after methylation studies showed no functional component of the paternal chromosome 15 imprinting centre. Past episodes of rectal bleeding at age 6, with a colonoscopy showing mucosal edema and a granulomatous mass at age 8. Familial history of congenital conditions was not specified.
medical_history.family_history: Father is 193 cm tall; mother had a normal pregnancy. Patient has four half-siblings aged 42–48 years. No specific health conditions in family were noted.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with elderly parents, receives a disability pension, has never worked, and requires special schooling. Frequent medical assessments, limited social activities due to weight and behavior issues, attends Club 15/18 for the intellectually disabled.
